results.title: Freefall
results.creator_credit: David Stacey and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: The choreographer and dancer, Gaby Agis, has a unique style, taking dance out of the confines of the theatre and into new spaces and contexts. For this film she has taken the dance to the city, essentially London. Gaby and her Company move through narrow streets and alleys, over rooftops, constant building sites and sudden, quiet green spaces, touching in a synthesis of choreography and place only possible through film.

results.title: Freedom to read
results.creator_credit: Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University, Erik Barnouw and Julian Roffman
results.brief_description: A discussion film dealing with the problem of censorship as it affects the public library. Dramatized incidents are used in presenting opposing points of view and in raising questions regarding the role of the Library in a democratic country.

results.title: Freedom of the press
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers, Irving Jacoby and Alexander Hammid
results.brief_description: An historical review of freedom of the press in America from Zenger’s weekly journal to the publication of today’s newspapers. The film covers one news story (President Truman’s tax proposal) to metropolitan, small town and rural newspapers. Differentiates between news reporting and editorialising.

results.title: Freedom is paradise = Ser swoboda eto rai
results.brief_description: Sasha Grigoriev, a 13 year old boy is an habitual escapee from the bleak reformatory in which he has been imprisoned. Sasha escapes, taking refuge with his aunt who hands him back to the authorities. There he accidentally discovers the whereabouts of his father who is serving a long prison sentence in a camp near the Arctic Circle.

results.title: Freedom from dust
results.brief_description: Surveys the problem of industrial air and water pollution, and the difficulties of effective waste disposal. Shows the instruments which are used to measure pollution in industrial areas, and the various possible measures to prevent or alleviate it.

results.title: Free Willy 3: the rescue
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Monarchy Enterprises B. V., Regency Entertainment (USA), Jennie Lew-Tugend and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Willy’s best friend, Jesse (Jason James Richter), is working with his mentor Randolph (August Schellenberg) monitoring whales off the Pacific Northwest coast. He befriends a young boy, Max, who shares Jesse’s love for whales. Max’s fisherman father however possesses a mysterious secret linked to the depleting orca population and it is up to Jesse and Max to embark on a rescue mission to save the whales. An entertaining family movie that is as much about whale conservation as it is about two boys love for whales. Also starring Annie Corley, Vincent Berry and Patrick Kilpatrick.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Shuler-Donner, Donner Productions, Lauren Shuler, Jennie Lew-Tugend and Dwight Little
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.

results.title: Free Willy
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal+, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: This is a heart warming and touching story about the friendship that develops between an abandoned child living in a foster home and an Orca (Killer Whale) who is confined in a too-small tank at Pacific Northwest aquatic park. At night Willy cries out to his family who frolic in the nearby bay. No-one can undestand his cries and moods - no one except Jesse (Jason James Richter) a 12 year old boy who knows what it is like to be without a family.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Studio Canal+, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler and Simon Wincer

results.title: Free to roam
results.creator_credit: Strand Film Zoological Productions, Stuart Legg and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description: At Whipsnade Zoo, 35 miles from London, there is an unusual zoo; a great expanse of English downland is reserved for animals to roam as they do in their native habitats. To the reserve come naturalists and zoologists from many countries, for on these 500 acres of English soil, animal life from all over the world may be studied. The film makes use of interesting natural sound.
